column4: Hi, I just tried running a 4d game call Adanaxis and now I can't boot up, the display is messed up. Does anyone know how to recover from this situation without reinstalling??
where do i get me a 4d game?
maybe screen res? try cycling resolution. ctrl alt +/- on keypad is kb shortcut
er, i read your comment in parts... missed the 'can't boot' part
where's it stop booting?
how far do you get before you notice an issue
two? o.O
are you familiar with the bootup process? POST, Operating system boot, etc?
whatever you've changed from default, prolly. unless you have an upgrade version
there are ways to fix these things. if you can find a local linux geek, they might be able to help you
so you get through POST ok, right?
you could try booting to a live disc, and uninstalling the game...
you'd have to mount your hard drive, & chroot to it in terminal
which is why i said to mount your hard drive, and chroot to it in terminal
chroot command: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chroot
chroot /path/to/mounted/drive
then it'll treat that path as root (/)
and further commands are treated as being run on that system
if it's a linux install that is
np. good luck
